events.title: Trump‚Äôs shadow war in Venezuela grows, but country‚Äôs strongman leader still clings to power
events.description: Report of a drone attack on a port facility signals new phase in US military campaign against Nicol√°s Maduro US wargames played out scenarios for Maduro‚Äôs fall. None of them ended well for Venezuela Nearly a week after Donald Trump first announced what he said was the first US ground strike in a four-month-long military pressure campaign against Venezuela , details remain very thin on the ground. CNN and the New York Times reported late on Monday that they had confirmed the CIA had used a drone to target a ‚Äúport facility‚Äù allegedly used by the Tren de Aragua street gang. No casualties were reported, but the date, time and location of the attack remain unknown. Venezuela‚Äôs strongman leader, Nicol√°s Maduro , and his government have remained silent. If confirmed, the first strike on land would mark a new phase in a campaign that since August has involved the deployment of a massive US naval fleet, airstrikes that have so far killed 107 people, a ‚Äútotal blockade‚Äù of sanctioned oil tankers, the seizure of two vessels and the pursuit of a third. Continue reading...

events.title: Coast Guard searches for survivors after US strikes suspected narco-terrorist vessels in Eastern Pacific
events.description: The U.S. Coast Guard is searching for survivors after strikes on suspected drug vessels in the Eastern Pacific. Three alleged narco-terrorists were killed, and others are missing.

events.title: Young man killed in apparent targeted drive-by shooting near police station in Melbourne‚Äôs inner north
events.description: Police investigation continues after fatal shooting in Fitzroy in early hours of Saturday morning Get our breaking news email , free app or daily news podcast A young man has been killed in what police believe was a targeted drive-by shooting outside a police station in Melbourne‚Äôs inner north in the early hours of Saturday morning. The attack took place just after midnight when a passing car opened fire on two young men walking across the road from a police station in Fitzroy. Continue reading...

events.title: Tension escalates between Iran and the United States as Trump threatens intervention
events.description: U.S. President Donald Trump and top Iranian officials exchanged dueling threats on January 2 as widening economic protests swept across parts of the Islamic Republic, further escalating tensions between the countries after America bombed Iranian nuclear sites in June. At least seven people have been killed so far in violence surrounding the demonstrations, which have increasingly seen crowds chanting anti-government slogans. FRANCE 24's Douglas Herbert tells us more about the situation.

events.title: Venezuela declares state of emergency over US 'attack'
events.description: Explosions have been heard in the Venezuelan capital of Caracas. Eyewitnesses reported seeing smoke rising from military installations and hearing aircraft overhead. Follow DW for more.

events.title: UN, US sign $2 billion humanitarian funding agreement for 17 crisis-hit countries
events.description: The United Nations and the United States on Monday formalized an agreement under which the US committed $2 billion in humanitarian assistance for global relief programmes, a move the UN‚Äôs top relief official hailed as a landmark commitment to saving lives amid escalating humanitarian needs worldwide.

events.title: Venezuela accuses US of attacking Caracas as explosions rock capital
events.description: Loud noises and low-flying aircraft were heard in the Venezuelan capital and a southern part of the city was without power Explosions rock Venezuela: latest news updates Venezuela‚Äôs authoritarian government has accused the US of launching a series of attacks against civilian and military targets in the South American country, after explosions rocked its capital, Caracas, before dawn on Saturday. In a statement, Venezuela‚Äôs government urged citizens to rise up against the assault and said Washington risked plunging Latin America into chaos with ‚Äúan extremely serious‚Äù act of ‚Äúmilitary aggression‚Äù. Continue reading...

events.title: Iran threatens Trump after 'locked and loaded' warning
events.description: Donald Trump has been threatened with a "swift, decisive and comprehensive" response by Iran if the US intervenes following growing unrest in the country, with at least 10 people killed and dozens of arrests, according to reports.

events.title: Anthony Joshua‚Äôs driver charged with dangerous driving after fatal crash in Nigeria
events.description: British boxer was injured in collision that killed his personal trainer Latif Ayodele and strength coach Sina Ghami Nigerian police have charged Anthony Joshua‚Äôs driver with causing death by dangerous driving after a fatal crash that killed two people. Adeniyi Mobolaji Kayode, 46, was also charged with driving without a valid driving licence and ‚Äúdriving without due care and attention, causing bodily harm and damage to property‚Äù. He is due to appear in court on 20 January. Continue reading...

events.title: Kenya: Multi-storey building collapses in Nairobi, with 4 people believed to be trapped
events.description: A multi-storey building under construction has collapsed in Nairobi, with at least four people feared to be trapped beneath the rubble. While the cause is yet to be confirmed, building collapses are common in Nairobi, where poor construction standards and weak regulation have long been blamed. A report by the National Construction Authority found that 58% of buildings in Nairobi are unfit for habitation. Rescue teams are on site as families plead for efforts to reach survivors to be sped up.

events.title: Drop draft proposals on death penalty for Palestinians, UN rights chief urges Israel
events.description: The UN‚Äôs top human rights official on Friday called on Israeli authorities to abandon plans for new legislation that would impose mandatory death sentences exclusively on Palestinians, warning the proposals violate international law and fundamental human rights standards.

events.title: FBI disrupts alleged ISIS-inspired New Year‚Äôs Eve attack plot targeting NC grocery store, fast food restaurant
events.description: Prosecutors say Christian Sturdivant, 18, of Mint Hill, N.C., allegedly plotted an attack on New Year's Eve in support of the Islamic State terrorist group.

events.title: Trump warning over Iran protests 'reckless' says foreign minister
events.description: The US president earlier said if peaceful protesters are killed, Washington "will come to their rescue".

events.title: Aboriginal woman‚Äôs death in custody in NT prompts calls for independent investigation
events.description: Police say woman‚Äôs death in Tennant Creek appeared to be the result of a medical episode, but Aboriginal legal service says internal investigation is ‚Äònot sufficient‚Äô Warning: This article contains references to Indigenous Australians who have died Get our breaking news email , free app or daily news podcast The Northern Territory‚Äôs peak Aboriginal legal service has called for an independent investigation after a 44-year-old Aboriginal mother of five died at the Tennant Creek watch house last Saturday. NT police said her death appeared to be the result of a medical episode inside her cell on 27 December, after she was arrested on Christmas Day for an alleged aggravated assault. Indigenous Australians can call 13YARN on 13 92 76 for information and crisis support; or call Lifeline on 13 11 14, Mensline on 1300 789 978 or Beyond Blue on 1300 22 4636 Continue reading...

events.title: Mexico: Powerful earthquake kills at least 2 people
events.description: The magnitude 6.5 earthquake shook the center and south of the country, which is one of the most seismically active in the world. The capital Mexico City and tourist hotspot Acapulco were affected.

events.title: Iranian protests amplify as they enter their sixth day
events.description: Current protests in Iran, now in their sixth day, have become the biggest since 2022, when the death of 22-year-old Mahsa Amini in police custody triggered nationwide demonstrations. Although protests took root in economic issues, demonstrator chants against Iran's theocracy have been heard. US President Donald Trump threatened the US could intervene were protestors killed, prompting government representatives to denounce a 'red line'.

events.title: Venezuela accuses US after explosions and low-flying aircraft reported in Caracas ‚Äì live
events.description: Venezuela‚Äôs government says it rejects ‚Äòmilitary aggression‚Äô by the US, after explosions rock Caracas Full report: Venezuela accuses US of attacking Caracas as explosions rock capital The Reuters news agency says it has been told by a US official, speaking on the condition of anonymity, that the US carried out strikes inside Venezuela on Saturday . The unnamed official did not provide details. As mentioned earlier, the White House and Pentagon did not immediately respond to request for comment on Saturday morning. Continue reading...

events.title: Ukrainians remember broken 1994 security promises as it negotiates with Russia
events.description: Ukrainians recall their country giving up nuclear weapons in 1994 in exchange for international security promises that weren't kept. They don't want a repeat in their current negotiations with Russia.

events.title: Partygoer seen trying to tackle flames in 'horror movie' ski resort fire that killed dozens
events.description: About 40 people were killed and 115 injured in a blaze in at a New Year's Eve Party at an upmarket Swiss ski resort, with the disaster likened to scenes from a horror film.

events.title: Woman suspected to have been killed in Colorado's first fatal mountain lion attack in over two decades
events.description: A woman's death on a trail is being investigated as a suspected deadly mountain lion attack, according to Colorado Parks and Wildlife.

events.title: Live: Venezuela accuses US of carrying out attacks in Caracas, other states
events.description: The government of President Nicolas Maduro declares ‚Äåa national ‚Äåemergency after series of attacks across the country.

events.title: Live: Venezuela declares state of emergency after reported US 'military aggression'
events.description: Venezuelan President Nicol√°s Maduro declared a state of emergency early on Saturday, accusing the United States of a ‚Äúvery serious military aggression‚Äù after multiple explosions and aircraft-like sounds were reported across the capital Caracas. Follow our liveblog for the latest updates.

events.title: WHO research shows COVID vaccines still crucial in preventing severe illness
events.description: Up-to-date vaccination remains the most effective way to prevent severe COVID-19 illness, new research from the World Health Organization (WHO) shows, even as the pandemic has officially ended.

events.title: Venezuela accuses US of bombing civilian, military installations
events.description: President Nicolas Maduro has declared a national state of emergency in Venezuela.

events.title: Maduro urges Trump to abandon ‚Äòillegal warmongering‚Äô and start ‚Äòserious talks‚Äô
events.description: Venezuelan president warns of a ‚Äòforever war‚Äô similar to Iraq after US counterpart claims first land strike on dock The Venezuelan leader, Nicol√°s Maduro, has urged Donald Trump to abandon his ‚Äúillegal warmongering‚Äù and begin ‚Äúserious talks‚Äù with his administration as mystery continued to surround a purported pre-Christmas CIA airstrike on the South American country. Speaking during an hour-long TV interview, Maduro declined to confirm reports of the apparent US attack, which would be the first on Venezuelan soil since Trump began his five-month campaign of military pressure in August. Continue reading...

events.title: Police to carry long-arm rifles at final Ashes Test in Sydney amid heightened security after Bondi attack
events.description: Decision to carry the weapons at SCG not due to active or imminent threat but ‚Äòto help the public feel safe‚Äô, NSW police chief says Get our breaking news email , free app or daily news podcast Police will carry long-arm rifles at the final Ashes Test in Sydney as police presence continues to be heightened after the Bondi terror attack. New South Wales police said public order and riot squad officers would carry the weapons at the fifth and final Ashes Test, which starts on Sunday at the Sydney Cricket Ground (SCG), after similar measures were implemented at the Boxing Day Test in Melbourne and New Year‚Äôs Eve events in Sydney. Continue reading...

events.title: Swiss investigators believe sparkling candles atop wine bottles ignited fatal bar fire
events.description: Investigators say they believe sparkling candles atop Champagne bottles ignited the fire at a Swiss ski resort when they came too close to the ceiling of a bar crowded with New Year's Eve revelers. Forty people were killed and another 119 injured.

events.title: Venezuela accuses US of attacks after explosions, aircraft heard over Caracas
events.description: Venezuela accused the United States on Saturday of striking civilian and military sites after multiple explosions and low-flying aircraft were reported in Caracas, leaving several areas without power.

events.title: Six people injured in the fatal fire at a Swiss bar remain unidentified. It's an unbearable wait
events.description: A fire at a bar in Crans-Montana, Switzerland, has left families desperate for news about missing loved ones

events.title: UN chief urges world leaders to ‚Äòget priorities straight‚Äô as New Year message calls for peace over war
events.description: As the world enters 2026 amid mounting crises, the UN Secretary-General Ant√≥nio Guterres has issued a stark but hopeful New Year appeal, urging global leaders to shift resources away from destruction and towards development, peace and people.

events.title: Iran in shutdown as protesters storm governor's office, crowds chant 'Death to Khamenei'
events.description: Iran security forces clashed with protesters in Tehran, Shiraz and Kermanshah as opposition groups report gunfire and demonstrators chant "Death to Khamenei" during unrest.

events.title: Two people killed in magnitude 6.5 earthquake in Mexico
events.description: The powerful earthquake shook southern and central Mexico on Friday, also leaving several people injured.

events.title: NSW Labor accused of rushing inquiry into banning phrases such as ‚Äòglobalise the intifada‚Äô over the holidays
events.description: State opposition leader says inquiry established ‚Äòwith no notice, no public hearings and an impossibly short deadline‚Äô Get our breaking news email , free app or daily news podcast A New South Wales parliamentary inquiry into banning phrases including ‚Äúglobalise the intifada‚Äù will not hold any public hearings and has a matter of days to receive submissions before it produces its final report. The NSW opposition has expressed concern that the Labor-controlled inquiry, established to investigate the banning of ‚Äúhateful statements‚Äù after the deadly Bondi attack, was being rushed through, limiting the ability of communities to consult on legislative changes. Continue reading...

events.title: Missile attack on Kharkiv kills two including child, authorities say
events.description: Russian officials say reports of the missile strike are untrue, suggesting the explosion was caused by Ukrainian ammunition.

events.title: Health advances marked 2025 as wars and funding cuts strained systems
events.description: From eliminating deadly infections to expanding access to lifesaving vaccines, 2025 delivered meaningful progress for global health, according to the UN World Health Organization (WHO), offering cautious optimism at the close of a year marked by both breakthroughs and strain.

events.title: Multiple explosions heard in Venezuela's Capital. Maduro accuses the U.S.
events.description: Multiple explosions and fires are being reported around Caracas. It is not immediately clear what is the cause of the blasts. The explosions began at around 2 am local time.

events.title: Iran protests turn deadly as anti-regime demonstrations enter fifth day
events.description: Anti-regime protests entered a fifth day as demonstrations spread across Tehran and other cities, with reports of deaths emerging amid escalating nationwide unrest.

events.title: Pope opens 2026 with plea for peace in countries bloodied by war, families wounded by violence

events.title: US: FBI arrests man over alleged NYE attack plot

events.title: Transport Canada warns Air India on drinking rules after pilot's Vancouver arrest

Follow live below and UN News app users can click here and go here for all our in-depth meeting coverage.

events.title: Dozens missing after boat carrying 200 migrants sinks off Gambia

events.title: Protests spread across Iran as regime threatens US forces as 'legitimate targets' after Trump warning
events.description: Iran's parliament speaker threatens U.S. military bases as 'legitimate targets' after Trump vows action over protest crackdowns. Tensions escalate.

events.title: Trump vows to 'rescue' Iran's protesters. Iran warns the U.S. to stay out of it
events.description: President Trump warned Iran not to kill protesters. Iranian officials alleged the U.S. and Israel were stoking the sweeping protests, and said U.S. military bases in the region are legitimate targets.

events.title: Woman killed in suspected mountain lion attack in US
events.description: Colorado officials said that it would be the first time in more than 25 years that a mountain lion killed a person in the state, if confirmed.

events.description: No description available.

events.title: Netanyahu warns of ‚Äòeighth front‚Äô ideological battle for American hearts and minds with Christian leaders
events.description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu warns of 'eighth front' in ideological battle, telling Christian leaders that faith must confront terrorism in defense of civilization.

events.title: Helicopters seen over Venezuelan capital as explosions rock city
events.description: Low-flying aircraft was seen over Venezuela‚Äôs capital, Caracas on Saturday as multiple explosions were heard.

events.title: Russia says 27 dead in Ukrainian strike; Zelenskyy names intell chief to new role
events.description: Russian authorities say a Ukrainian drone strike on a caf√© in the Kherson region has killed 27 people

events.title: Revelers at Swiss Alpine bar describe horror and panic when a fire broke out, leaving about 40 dead
events.description: A New Year‚Äôs party at a Swiss Alpine bar turned into a tragedy after about 40 people died in a fire and another roughly 115 were injured, many in their teens to mid-20s

events.title: Ukraine: Attacks disrupt heating as temperatures plunge
events.description: Recent attacks across Ukraine have killed civilians, damaged critical infrastructure and cut heating and power supplies for millions, UN humanitarians report, as temperatures drop below freezing.

events.title: Swiss bar fire likely started by sparklers on champagne bottles
events.description: The investigation into the fire that killed 40 people will consider whether criminal prosecutions are necessary, officials said.

events.title: Maduro says Venezuela open to US talks on drug trafficking
events.description: In an interview with state TV, the Venezuelan president also evaded a question about an attack in his country claimed by the US.

events.title: Iran protests: Trump and Tehran officials exchange threats
events.description: President Donald Trump said the US is "locked and loaded," but analysts told DW that more violence wouldn't help protesters.

events.title: Security Council: New faces, old tensions as five nations take their seats
events.description: From deploying peacekeepers to conducting quiet ‚Äì but at times heated ‚Äì diplomacy, the UN Security Council sits at the heart of global decision-making on war and peace. As of January, five new countries will have a seat around the iconic horseshoe table.

events.title: Pope Leo XIV opens 2026 urging world to reject violence in powerful New Year's Day message
events.description: Pope Leo XIV delivered a message of peace to 40,000 gathered in St. Peter's Square on New Year's Day, calling for disarmed hearts and an end to all forms of violence in 2026.

events.title: Tensions between Saudis and Emiratis over future of Yemen reach boiling point
events.description: Dispute has potential to create civil war in south of Yemen and spill over into neighbouring countries Tensions between the United Arab Emirates and Saudi Arabia over the future of Yemen and the imminent possibility of the declaration of an independent southern state have reached boiling point with Saudi Arabia in effect accusing the UAE of threatening its future security. The dispute has the potential to create a civil war within the south of Yemen and also spill over into other disputes including in Sudan and the Horn of Africa where the two countries often find themselves backing opposite sides. Yemen could yet become only one theatre in which the two vastly wealthy Gulf states vie for political influence, control of shipping lanes and commercial access. Continue reading...

events.title: Missing worker could be trapped 1km underground after Queensland mine collapses
events.description: Two workers have been recovered safely from Curragh coalmine as search continues for missing man Get our breaking news email , free app or daily news podcast A worker is missing and another is recovering in hospital after a roof collapse at a coalmine. Police were called to Curragh coalmine, in central Queensland, about 3pm on Friday. Continue reading...

events.title: Sexual violence against children ‚Äòentrenched, systemic and widespread‚Äô across DR Congo, UNICEF warns
events.description: Sexual violence against children has become entrenched, systemic and increasingly widespread across the Democratic Republic of the Congo (DRC), with new data showing a sharp rise in cases since 2022, according to the UN Children‚Äôs Fund (UNICEF).

events.title: Runner fought off mountain lion with stick just weeks before fatal attack on same Colorado trail
events.description: A Colorado hiker fought off a mountain lion with a stick after being rushed on a trail where a woman was found dead weeks later in a suspected wildlife attack.

events.title: Off-duty ICE agent takes down armed man firing rifle at LA apartment complex
events.description: Off-duty ICE agent confronted armed neighbor firing rifle shots into the air at Los Angeles apartment complex on New Year's Eve, fatally shooting the gunman.

events.title: Putin residence attack video slammed; US officials say Ukraine did not target leader
events.description: Defense experts questioned Russia's drone attack claims against President Vladimir Putin's residence after Moscow provides conflicting accounts of intercepted Ukrainian drones.

events.title: They bought an abandoned 'ghost house' in the Japanese countryside
events.description: He'd spent years backpacking around the world, and Japanese traveler Daisuke Kajiyama was finally ready to return home to pursue his long-held dream of opening up a guesthouse.

events.title: George Clooney gets French citizenship ‚Äî and another dust-up with Trump
events.description: The French government says it granted George and Amal Clooney citizenship because of their contributions to its international influence. Their family has primarily lived in France since 2021.

events.title: The ban of NGOs from Gaza 'will have a profound effect' on the territory's population
events.description: Israel has enforced its ban on 37 NGOs supplying aid in Gaza from the territory, in a move which has been largely criticised internationally as likely to worsen an already critical humanitarian situation. The ban 'will have a profound effect' on Gaza Tirza Leibowitz, Deputy Director of Physicians for Human Rights Israel, tells FRANCE 24.

events.title: Multiple explosions, aircraft sounds reported in Venezuela‚Äôs Caracas
events.description: No description available.

events.title: Secret operation unveiled: Ukraine fakes death of anti-Kremlin Russian fighter
events.description: Ukraine staged the death of an anti-Kremlin Russian fighter, Denis Kapustin, to prevent his killing ordered by Moscow's special forces, Ukrainian military intelligence announced Thursday. His assassination, GUR said in a statement, "was ordered by the special services of the aggressor state Russia, which allocated half a million dollars to carry out the crime."

events.title: Pakistan sentences journalists, YouTubers and ex-military officers to life over inciting violence
events.description: A court in Pakistan‚Äôs capital has sentenced seven people to life imprisonment after convicting them of inciting violence

events.title: Trump orders strikes in Venezuela as Maduro accuses 'very serious military aggression'
events.description: The U.S. military carried out air strikes in various areas of Venezuela, including the capital of Caracas, early Saturday morning, officials confirmed to Fox News.

events.title: 'Living a nightmare': Families of teens missing after ski resort fire desperate for news
events.description: Families are appealing for information about children as young as 15 who are thought to have been at the bar.

events.title: Anthony Joshua's driver charged over Nigeria crash that killed two
events.description: The former heavyweight champion was a passenger in the crash, which killed two of his team members on Monday.

events.title: Video shows aftermath of explosions in Venezuela
events.description: Video from the port city of La Guaira shows the aftermath of explosions that took place across Venezuela.

events.title: Fire at Swiss resort bar kills 40 people, injures over 100
events.description: About 40 people are dead and more than 100 are injured after a fire ripped through a New Year's Eve party at a Swiss ski resort bar. Authorities are still investigating what caused the blaze.

events.title: How hundreds have died in nightclub blazes caused by indoor fireworks
events.description: The death of at least 40 people in a New Year's Eve fire in a Swiss ski resort has once again highlighted the dangers of igniting indoor fireworks in bars and nightclubs.

events.title: Thailand releases 18 Cambodian prisoners of war as part of ceasefire agreement
events.description: Thailand has repatriated 18 Cambodian prisoners of war

events.title: Trump warns US will intervene if Iran starts killing protesters and more top headlines
events.description: Get all the stories you need-to-know from the most powerful name in news delivered first thing every morning to your inbox.

events.title: France reportedly planning to ban children under 15 from social media starting 2026
events.description: France planning social media ban for children under 15, following Australia's lead. Macron pushes new digital restrictions amid youth violence concerns.

events.title: These were the best and worst places for air quality in 2021, new report shows
events.description: Air pollution spiked to unhealthy levels around the world in 2021, according to a new report.

events.title: Earthquake with a preliminary magnitude of 6.5 rattles southern and central Mexico

events.title: A woman dies from cervical cancer every two minutes, UN says
events.description: A flood of questions drowned Jeanette in thought after she was diagnosed with cervical cancer. Would she be unable to conceive a child? Would she have to enter menopause at the early age of 31?

events.title: Another child dies in extreme conditions in Gaza: UNICEF
events.description: A sixth child has died in Gaza this month as the enclave‚Äôs people continue to endure dire living conditions linked to freezing rains and the Israel-Hamas war, the UN Children‚Äôs Fund (UNICEF) has announced. The development comes as aid agencies urged Israeli authorities to reconsider revoking the licences of dozens of humanitarian partners that provide assistance across the devastated enclave from 1 January.

events.title: Ukraine: Zelenskyy names new chief of staff
events.description: Ukraine's popular military intelligence head, Kyrylo Budanov, has been appointed chief of staff. Meanwhile, Ukraine has reported two missile strikes in residential areas of Kharkiv.

events.title: Swiss fire safety under scrutiny after Crans-Montana blaze
events.description: After the deadly fire at the Constellation bar in the Swiss ski resort of Crans-Montana, questions are growing about the country's safety regulations.

events.title: Understanding Iran‚Äôs protest chants: What are demonstrators‚Äô demands?
events.description: Iran has entered the sixth day of protests that began with shopkeepers decrying the rising cost of living, but have become increasingly political as students have joined the demonstrations. The most popular protest chants are now directed at the country‚Äôs law enforcement and leadership ‚Äì FRANCE 24 explains what the protesters are calling for.

events.title: Crans-Montana fire likely caused by sparklers on Champagne bottles
events.description: Initial investigations ‚Äãsuggest that ‚Å†the fire which tore through a Swiss ski resort ‚Äãbar started ‚Äçwhen 'fountain candles' attached ‚Äãto champagne bottles were carried ‚Äãaloft too close to the ceiling, the local prosecutor said on Friday. Authorities planned to look into whether the material on the ceiling that was designed to muffle sound conformed with regulations. FRANCE 24's Olivia Bizot is on the ground.

events.title: Sudan: UN warns of unprecedented child hunger in Darfur as fighting fuels refugee exodus
events.description: Sudan‚Äôs deepening war is driving unprecedented levels of hunger, child malnutrition and displacement, UN agencies report, as new data from Darfur and a renewed refugee influx into Chad underscore the rapidly deteriorating situation.

events.title: Gaza battered by heavy rains as humanitarian response continues
events.description: Severe weather conditions have led to further casualties and heightened health risks in Gaza over the past 24 hours, the UN aid coordination office (OCHA) reported on Monday.

events.title: California defies deadline on immigrant trucker licenses as feds threaten funding cuts
events.description: California delays crackdown on immigrant commercial driver's licenses until March, defying federal deadline and risking $160 million in funding cuts.

events.title: Ukraine tricks Russia into paying $500K bounty for fake hit on Putin opponent: report
events.description: Ukraine faked the assassination of Russian opposition leader Denis Kapustin to trick Moscow into paying a $500,000 bounty that funded the war effort.

events.title: At least 40 dead in fire at Swiss Alps bar during New Year‚Äôs celebrations, police say
events.description: An explosive fire broke out during a New Year‚Äôs Eve celebration at a crowded bar in the Swiss Alps, killing around 40 people and injuring others, according to Swiss police.

events.title: China's BYD overtakes Tesla as world's top EV seller

events.title: The surreal facades of America's strip clubs
events.description: Some people travel the world in search of adventure, while others seek out natural wonders, cultural landmarks or culinary experiences. But French photographer Fran√ßois Prost was looking for something altogether different during his recent road trip across America: strip clubs.

events.title: Cremation pyre in Africa thought to be world‚Äôs oldest containing adult remains
events.description: 9,500-year-old pyre uncovered in Malawi offers rare insight into rituals of ancient African hunter-gatherer groups A cremation pyre built about 9,500 years ago has been discovered in Africa, offering a fresh glimpse into the complexity of ancient hunter-gatherer communities. Researchers say the pyre, discovered in a rock shelter at the foot of Mount Hora in northern Malawi, is thought to be the oldest in the world to contain adult remains, the oldest confirmed intentional cremation in Africa, and the first pyre to be associated with African hunter-gatherers. Continue reading...

events.title: China's BYD overtakes Tesla as world's top EV seller
events.description: Elon Musk's Tesla has had a tough year and faced intensifying competition from Chinese and European rivals.

events.title: Replay: Watch Swiss authorities' update on the deadly Crans-Montana fire

events.title: Trump, top Iranian security official exchange threats over protests now roiling Iran
events.description: U.S. President Donald Trump and a top Iranian security official have exchanged dueling threats as widening economic protests swept across parts of the Islamic Republic

events.title: Fox News ‚ÄòAntisemitism Exposed‚Äô Newsletter: You won't believe what TikTok was selling
events.description: Fox News' "Antisemitism Exposed" newsletter brings you stories on the rising anti-Jewish prejudice across the U.S. and the world.

events.title: Officials race to identify mostly young victims of deadly Swiss Alps bar fire
events.description: Deadly New Year's Eve bar fire at Swiss ski resort kills around 40 people, mostly young victims as the investigation and identification process continues.

events.title: China‚Äôs ‚Äòcondom tax‚Äô sparks backlash as Beijing struggles to reverse population collapse
events.description: China introduced a 13% tax on contraceptives while exempting childcare services as the global superpower battles sustained population decline and aging demographics.

events.title: Indian families grieve deaths caused by contaminated tap water
events.description: Officials in Indore say four people have died after drinking contaminated water but families allege the toll is higher.

events.title: Saudi Arabia welcomes request from Yemen to help resolve southern battle
events.description: Saudi foreign ministry calls on southern factions in Yemen to participate in a forum in Riyadh amid rising casualties.

events.title: Russia-Ukraine war: List of key events, day 1,409
events.description: These are the key developments from day 1,409 of Russia‚Äôs war on Ukraine.

events.title: Retail spending fell in March as consumers pull back
events.description: Spending at US retailers fell in March as consumers pulled back amid recessionary fears fueled by the banking crisis.

events.title: Israeli podcast duo use platform to reflect on the war in Gaza
events.description: A podcast by two Israelis re-examines the war in Gaza and its impact on Israeli society.

events.title: Why Trump wants to push Venezuela's Maduro out of power
events.description: The latest attacks on Caracas suggest regime change is top of the White House agenda when it comes to Venezuela. But the ultimate purpose may not be purely to restore democracy.

events.title: Yemen separatists plan transition to independence by 2028
events.description: The Southern Transitional Council said independence would be "immediate" if attacks against them continue.

events.title: Ukraine's Zelensky names spy chief Kyrylo Budanov as new top aide
events.description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky on Friday appointed military intelligence chief Kyrylo Budanov as head of his office, following the resignation of top aide Andriy Yermak over a corruption scandal. Budanov, credited with daring operations against Russia, will focus on security, defence and diplomatic efforts amid the ongoing war.

events.title: Russia makes largest territorial gains in Ukraine since 2022 invasion
events.description: Russia captured more than 5,600 sq km of Ukrainian territory in 2025, its largest advance since 2022, as Kyiv prepares to host allied security talks. As pressure on the battlefield continues to build, President Volodymyr Zelensky named Kyrylo Budanov his new top aide, proposed Mykhailo Fedorov as defence minister and ordered the evacuation of thousands from frontline settlements.

events.title: Hollywood actress Angelina Jolie meets Gaza aid workers at Rafah crossing
events.description: Angelina Jolie visited the Egyptian side of the Rafah crossing on Friday, meeting Red Crescent volunteers and aid truck drivers delivering supplies to Gaza. The Hollywood star assessed conditions for injured Palestinians and the flow of humanitarian aid, highlighting the urgent challenges at the border amid the ongoing blockade.

events.title: How sanctions are boosting Russian wine
events.description: You've probably never had a glass of Russian sparkling wine before. Perhaps you never even knew such a thing existed. If that's the case, Mikhail Nikolaev believes you're missing out.

events.title: Maduro open to US talks on drug trafficking, but silent on CIA strike
events.description: Venezuela is open to reaching an agreement with the United States to combat drug trafficking, according to President Nicol√°s Maduro

events.title: New year dawns amid rubble and resolve in Gaza
events.description: As 2026 begins, residents of the Gaza Strip are confronting life in displacement camps and among the ruins of destroyed neighbourhoods ‚Äì facing deep uncertainty after months of war and devastation.

events.title: Teens' viral prank targeting homeowners could have deadly consequences, police warn
events.description: Kansas police warn about dangerous "door kick challenge" TikTok trend where teens kick doors to mimic home invasions, risking criminal charges and safety.

events.title: Putin vows victory in Ukraine in New Year‚Äôs address amid Trump-backed peace talks
events.description: Russian President Vladimir Putin's defiant New Year's message contrasts sharply with President Donald Trump's diplomatic push as Ukraine-Russia war approaches fourth year.

events.title: Middle Eastern governments are watching Iran's protests
events.description: As anti-government protests continue in Iran, countries in the region are watching. Some are concerned; others sense potential opportunity.

events.title: Iranian protesters facing 'brutal crackdown' as protests amplify
events.description: Amid large protests in Iran, contradictory messages are being sent out. While the president seems to have adopted a conciliatory tone, other reports from the ground talk of live ammunition being used against protesters, with the worry that this a brutal crackdown is underway. FRANCE 24's Rochelle Ferguson Bouyahi tells us more.

events.title: Silicon Valley Bank collapse renews calls to address disparities impacting entrepreneurs of color
events.description: When customers at Silicon Valley Bank rushed to withdraw billions of dollars last month, venture capitalist Arlan Hamilton stepped in to help some of the founders of color who panicked about losing access to payroll funds.

events.title: Guinea‚Äôs junta chief elected president after opposition boycott
events.description: Mamady Doumbouya reneged on promise not to stand and hand west African country back to civilian rule The head of Guinea‚Äôs junta, Mamady Doumbouya, who had pledged not to run for office after seizing power four years ago, has been elected president after the country‚Äôs electoral commission said he had secured a sweeping majority of the vote. Doumbouya, 41, faced eight rivals for the presidency but the main opposition leaders were barred from running and had urged a boycott of the vote held over the weekend. Continue reading...

events.title: CAR: Touadera expected to win 'peaceful' election
events.description: The Central African Republic held relatively peaceful elections on December 28, widely seen as a test for President Touadera's decade in power. But can the country entrench stability and deliver economic transformation?

events.title: What to know about the Ukrainian general picked by Zelenskyy to be his new chief of staff
events.description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has announced Gen. Kyrylo Budanov, the head of the country‚Äôs military intelligence service, as his new chief of staff

events.title: Indonesia‚Äôs new penal code takes effect, marking historic break with colonial law
events.description: Indonesia has begun enforcing its newly ratified penal code, replacing a Dutch-era criminal law that had governed the country for more than 80 years and marking a major shift in its legal landscape

events.title: Brazil's Bolsonaro leaves hospital and returns to jail in capital Brasilia
events.description: Former Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro left a hospital in capital Brasilia on Thursday, a week after he underwent a double hernia surgery

events.title: Venezuela arrests more Americans as Trump ramps up pressure on Maduro: report
events.description: Secretary of State Marco Rubio confirmed 10 Americans were freed from Venezuela in a July prisoner swap. President Donald Trump sent an envoy to Caracas.

events.title: Zelensky names spy chief to head presidential office after corruption row
events.description: Kyrylo Budanov has led the Hur military intelligence, which has claimed a number of highly-effective strikes against Russia.

events.title: Iranians face mounting hardship as protests intensify
events.description: Protests have entered a second week across Iran, driven by anger over soaring prices, inflation, and a plunging currency

events.title: US Coast Guard suspends search for survivors of Pacific boat strike
events.description: Search in undisclosed location followed the latest US military strike on alleged drug smuggling boats.

events.title: UN chief Guterres calls on Israel to reverse NGO ban in Gaza, West Bank
events.description: Guterres says pending ban targets groups 'indispensable to life-saving' work, undermines ceasefire progress.

events.title: South Carolina measles outbreak grows to 185 cases amid vaccination worries
events.description: The outbreak comes after the US charted its highest number of annual measles cases in more than three decades in 2025.

events.title: Liensberger to miss Olympics after latest serious skiing accident
events.description: Austria's Katharina Liensberger to miss Milano Cortina Winter Games after knee injury in alpine skiing training fall.

events.title: US ‚Äòadapt, shrink or die‚Äô terms for $2bn aid pot will mean UN bowing down to Washington, say experts
events.description: Afghanistan and Yemen excluded from list of 17 priority countries chosen by Trump administration to receive aid laden with demands The $2bn (¬£1.5bn) of aid the US pledged this week may have been hailed as ‚Äúbold and ambitious‚Äù by the UN but could be the ‚Äúnail in the coffin‚Äù in changing to a shrunken, less flexible aid system dominated by Washington‚Äôs political priorities, aid experts fear. After a year of deep cuts in aid budgets by the US and European countries, the announcement of new money for the humanitarian system is a source of some relief, but experts are deeply concerned about demands that the US has imposed on how the money should be managed and where it can go. Continue reading...

events.title: Taiwan's president pledges to defend island's sovereignty after Chinese military drills
events.description: Taiwanese President Lai Ching-te vowed to defend the self-ruled island's sovereignty in the face of what he termed China's "expansionist ambitions," days after Beijing wrapped up live-fire military drills near its shores.

events.title: Swiss resort fire: Sparklers likely cause, authorities say
events.description: The fire that tore through a bar in Crans-Montana was likely started by sparklers in Champagne bottles coming too close to the ceiling, authorities have said. Follow DW for more.

events.title: Crans-Montana fire: Swiss officials believe ‚Äúcandles and sparklers‚Äù started blaze
events.description: No description available.

events.title: Anthony Joshua's driver charged over deadly Nigeria crash
events.description: The man behind the wheel of a car that crashed into a lorry in Nigeria, killing two passengers and injuring Anthony Joshua has been charged.

events.title: Why 'Grenfell-like' material made fire spread so fast
events.description: Flammable sound-proofing material is likely to blame for the rapid spread of the deadly fire at a Swiss ski resort, Sky News has been told.

events.title: Witness saw people 'walking on top of others' as they tried to escape fire in packed bar
events.description: A man who witnessed a bar fire in Switzerland has told Sky News he saw patrons walking over people as they tried to escape the packed venue.

events.title: Gaza aid lifelines under strain as winter worsens
events.description: Humanitarian partners in the Gaza Strip are struggling to reach hundreds of thousands of vulnerable people as winter storms batter damaged homes and temporary shelters.

events.title: EXCLUSIVE: Mom speaks out after illegal alien DUI suspect allegedly kills 8-year-old, maims Marine dad
events.description: Grieving mom demands justice after allegedly intoxicated illegal immigrant kills 8-year-old daughter in crash, leaves Marine father fighting for his life.

events.title: University of Oklahoma teaching assistant fired after flunking Christian student files appeal with school
events.description: Fired University of Oklahoma teaching assistant appeals decision, denies wrongdoing in grading Christian student's paper on gender roles and biblical beliefs.

events.title: Swiss nightclub promoted flaming bottle stunts before deadly inferno in packed New Year's Eve venue
events.description: New Year's Eve nightclub fire in Swiss resort Crans-Montana kills 40, injures 119. Witnesses say bartender carried lit sparkler near wooden ceiling before flames erupted.

events.title: Witnesses give harrowing accounts of New Year's horror that erupted due to Swiss ski resort bar fire

events.title: Maduro says Venezuela is 'ready' to make deal with US on drugs and oil after military strikes
events.description: Venezuelan President Nicol√°s Maduro says his government is ready to negotiate a drug trafficking agreement with the U.S. after months of military pressure.

events.title: Not only is Lake Powell's water level plummeting because of drought, its total capacity is shrinking, too
events.description: Lake Powell, the second-largest human-made reservoir in the US, has lost nearly 7% of its potential storage capacity since 1963, when Glen Canyon Dam was built, a new report shows.

events.title: Kim Jong-un‚Äôs daughter visits state mausoleum, fuelling speculation she will be next North Korean ruler
events.description: Kim Ju-ae has been making increasingly prominent appearances in state media over the past three years The daughter of the North Korean ruler, Kim Jong-un, who is likely being prepared as his successor has accompanied her parents on her first public visit to the Kumsusan mausoleum to pay respects to former leaders, ahead of an event that could see her succession formalised. Photos from state news agency KCNA showed Kim Jong-un accompanied by his wife, Ri Sol-ju, and senior officials on the visit on 1 January, with Ju-ae between her parents in the main hall of the Kumsusan Palace of the Sun. Continue reading...

events.title: NewJeans member Danielle sued for millions after bitter feud with K-pop record label
events.description: Ador terminated the Australian-born singer‚Äôs contract on Monday and is now suing her, a family member and the band‚Äôs former producer The K-pop record label Ador is suing a former member of megaband NewJeans for millions in damages, it has announced, a day after removing her from the group following a year-long dispute that saw the band allege mistreatment and attempt to leave their contract. The compensation suit against Danielle Marsh, a 20-year-old Australian-born singer, comes months after a Seoul district court ruled that NewJeans‚Äô five members must honour their contracts with Ador, whose parent company Hybe is also behind the K-pop sensation BTS. The band‚Äôs contract runs until 2029. Continue reading...

events.title: 'The State of South Arabia': Yemen separatists announce plan for independence
events.description: Yemen's southern separatist movement has announced a constitution and aims to hold a referendum on independence from the north.

events.title: Results expected 5 January after landmark elections in Central African Republic
events.description: Voting proceeded largely as planned in the Central African Republic‚Äôs first-ever combined presidential, legislative, regional and municipal elections, and ballot counting is now complete, the UN peacekeeping mission (MINUSCA) said on Wednesday, with results expected to be announced on 5 January.

events.title: Georgia teen charged with murdering Uber driver in suburban carjacking, leaving him to die
events.description: Teen charged as adult with murder after Uber driver found shot dead following alleged carjacking incident in suburban Atlanta area on New Year's Day.

events.title: Look of the Week: Blackpink headline Coachella in Korean hanboks
events.description: Bringing the second day of this year's Coachella to a close, K-Pop girl group Blackpink made history Saturday night when they became the first Asian act to ever headline the festival. To a crowd of, reportedly, over 125,000 people, Jennie, Jisoo, Lisa and Ros√© used the ground-breaking moment to pay homage to Korean heritage by arriving onstage in hanboks: a traditional type of dress.

events.title: How Playboy cut ties with Hugh Hefner to create a post-MeToo brand
events.description: Hugh Hefner launched Playboy Magazine 70 years ago this year. The first issue included a nude photograph of Marilyn Monroe, which he had purchased and published without her knowledge or consent.

events.title: Germany: Third bank robbery reported in NRW in days
events.description: Another day, another report of a robbery at a Sparkasse bank in western Germany. This time, four safe-deposit boxes were emptied in broad daylight.

events.title: Live: Kyiv hosts high-level security talks with Ukraine's allies
events.description: Ukraine is set to host security advisers from around 15 countries in Kyiv on Saturday for talks on a US-brokered peace plan as President Volodymyr Zelensky said negotiations were nearing a deal, despite unresolved territorial issues and Russian claims of setbacks. Follow our liveblog for the latest updates.

events.title: Chadian victims of 2007 French false adoption scandal still seeking compensation
events.description: Eighteen years after the scandal of false African adoptions involving the French NGO Zoe's Ark, many of the Chadian victims are still fighting for compensation. FRANCE 24's Harold Girard and Fadile Bhayat report.

events.title: Kim Jong Un appears with daughter at mausoleum, fueling succession speculation
events.description: Kim Jong Un's daughter, Ju Ae, appeared at a sacred mausoleum, fueling speculation about North Korea's succession plan as analysts debate her role.

events.title: University of Alabama student suffers 'severe head injury' while on family vacation in Caribbean

events.description: New York's new mayor Zohran Mamdani has vowed to run the city "expansively and audaciously" after his historic inauguration.

events.description: Russian President Vladimir Putin used his New Year speech to tell troops that he "believed in you and our victory" in Ukraine.

events.description: Qatar, Turkiye and six other countries urge 'unimpeded' humanitarian access to Gaza as Israel cracks down on aid groups.

events.title: Analysis: Fox News is about to enter the true No Spin Zone
events.description: This is it.

events.title: Scientists identify secret ingredient in Leonardo da Vinci paintings
events.description: "Old Masters" such as Leonardo da Vinci, Sandro Botticelli and Rembrandt may have used proteins, especially egg yolk, in their oil paintings, according to a new study.

events.title: 'A definitive backslide.' Inside fashion's worrying runway trend
events.description: Now that the Fall-Winter 2023 catwalks have been disassembled, it's clear one trend was more pervasive than any collective penchant for ruffles, pleated skirts or tailored coats.

events.title: Michael Jordan's 1998 NBA Finals sneakers sell for a record $2.2 million
events.description: In 1998, Michael Jordan laced up a pair of his iconic black and red Air Jordan 13s to bring home a Bulls victory during Game 2 of his final NBA championship ‚Äî and now they are the most expensive sneakers ever to sell at auction. The game-winning sneakers sold for $2.2 million at Sotheby's in New York on Tuesday, smashing the sneaker auction record of $1.47 million, set in 2021 by a pair of Nike Air Ships that Jordan wore earlier in his career.

events.title: Here's the real reason to turn on airplane mode when you fly
events.description: We all know the routine by heart: "Please ensure your seats are in the upright position, tray tables stowed, window shades are up, laptops are stored in the overhead bins and electronic devices are set to flight mode."

The treatment went well and the former Brazilian president‚Äôs condition is stable, according to his medical team. Continue reading...

events.description: Reunification ‚Äòis unstoppable‚Äô, says Chinese president, a day after the conclusion of intense military drills China‚Äôs president, Xi Jinping, has vowed to reunify China and Taiwan in his annual New Year‚Äôs Eve speech in Beijing. Speaking the day after the conclusion of intense Chinese military drills around Taiwan, Xi said: ‚ÄúThe reunification of our motherland, a trend of the times, is unstoppable.‚Äù Continue reading...

events.title: China forecast to have sold one in every 10 new cars in UK in 2025
events.description: Carmakers such as MG, BYD and Chery are set to pass 200,000 mark in sales, analysis suggests, double 2024‚Äôs total Chinese brands are on course to account for one in every 10 new cars sold in Britain during 2025, a marked increase on last year as sales increase across Europe. Manufacturers led by MG, BYD, and Chery are on track to break the 200,000 mark in UK new car sales in 2025, meaning they are very likely to account for 10% of the market, according to Matthias Schmidt, an analyst tracking electric cars across Europe. Continue reading...

events.title: ‚ÄãTwo cubicles, 73 women, one long queue: Japan‚Äôs female MPs fight for more loos
events.description: PM Sanae Takaichi joins petition asking for better facilities for women to match improved representation Nearly 60 female lawmakers in Japan, including the prime minister, Sanae Takaichi, have submitted a petition calling for more toilets in the parliament building for women to match their improved representation. Japanese politics remains hugely male-dominated, although the number of women in the parliament rose at the last election ‚Äì and Takaichi became the first female prime minister in October. This is reflected by there being only one lavatory containing two cubicles for the lower house‚Äôs 73 women to use near the Diet‚Äôs main plenary session hall in central Tokyo. Continue reading...

events.title: General Assembly approves $3.45 billion UN regular budget for 2026
events.description: The General Assembly has approved a $3.45 billion regular budget for the United Nations for 2026, following weeks of intensive negotiations and one of the Organization‚Äôs most important reform initiatives, UN80.

events.title: LIVE: General Assembly decides on 2026 UN budget
events.description: Follow our live coverage as the General Assembly and its Fifth Committee meet today to finalize negotiations and vote on the United Nations‚Äô regular budget for 2026. The Fifth Committee is responsible for administrative and budgetary matters, including the Organization‚Äôs finances and staffing. UN News app users can click here and go here for all our in-depth meeting coverage.

events.title: Police seek suspect after dentist and wife found shot dead at home while 2 young children are unharmed
events.description: Columbus dentist Spencer Tepe and wife Monique found shot dead in their home just weeks before their fifth wedding anniversary. Two children unharmed.

events.title: Fox News True Crime Newsletter: Bryan Kohberger video, Slender Man stabber's fate, Luigi Mangione trial

events.title: Professor slams 'sneaky approach' to oppression-based teaching of American history: 'fantastically false'

events.title: McDonald's customer caught on camera launching flying kick at employee during heated brawl
